info.name: HCM Test Suite
info.description:
# HCM Test Suite

HCM Test Suite is a Testing framework based on Postman syntax with several helpers like chai js, Postman BDD, Lodash and some task execution tools like newman(In order to integrate with jenkins) and npm, all these tools works togheter in order to validate service responses and bussiness requirements.

----
## What do i need to know before contributing content in this collection?
see [Postman](https://www.getpostman.com/)
> Postman is a powerful HTTP client for testing web services.

see [Newman](https://github.com/postmanlabs/newman)
> Newman is a command-line collection runner for Postman

see [Javascript basics](https://www.javascript.com/learn/javascript/strings)
> Javascript is the language that we will be using for test designing and execution.

see [JSON](http://www.json.org/)
> JSON is short for JavaScript Object Notation, and is a way to store information in an organized, easy-to-access manner. In a nutshell, it gives us a human-readable collection of data that we can access in a really logical manner.

see [JSON Schema](https://spacetelescope.github.io/understanding-json-schema/index.html)
> JSON Schema specifies a JSON-based format to define the structure of JSON data for validation, documentation, and interaction control.

see [Chai JS](http://chaijs.com/)
> Chai is a BDD / TDD assertion library for node and the browser that can be delightfully paired with any javascript testing framework.

see [Node JS](https://nodejs.org/es/)
> Node.js is a platform built on Chrome's JavaScript runtime for easily building fast and scalable network applications.

## Useful links
see [Using BDD style on postman tests](https://www.npmjs.com/package/postman-bdd)

see [JSON Schema generator](https://jsonschema.net/#/editor)

see [Markdown in API Documentation](https://help.github.com/articles/basic-writing-and-formatting-syntax/)

see [Markdown Live Preview Tool](http://markdownlivepreview.com/)

## Installing

 1. Clone repository from [HCM repository](https://bitbucket.org/EslabonHCM/hcm-test-suite)
 2. Install [Node JS & npm](https://nodejs.org/es/)
 3. Install [Newman](https://www.npmjs.com/package/newman), also can be installed by openning a git bash or cmd console at hcm-test-suite folder and write: ``npm install``

## How to run the tests(Newman)

 1. Open a git bash terminal from [hcm-test-suite](https://bitbucket.org/EslabonHCM/hcm-test-suite) folder.
 2. According to desired test execution, you can execute scripts declared at  package.json, example: ``npm run test-UAT`` will execute the complete test suite at UAT environment.

***Example of package.json file:***
```json
{
  "name": "hmc-api-test-suite",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "Holds for Postman tests",
  "scripts": {
    "test-QA": "node tests/QA_newman_config.js",
    "test-UAT": "node tests/UAT_newman_config.js"
  },
  "author": "Rene Alfaro",
  "dependencies": {
    "newman": "^3.8.3"
  }
}

```

request.description:
# Setting DBB Syntaxis

>This request downloads [Postman BDD](https://www.npmjs.com/package/postman-bdd) and then "installs" it by setting in to a global variable called `postmanBDD`

This variable can be used by putting the code `eval(globals.postmanBDD);` on the test script section in order to use [chai js](http://chaijs.com/api/bdd/) functionality.

exec: *              Contains common test that can be executed on almost every request.
* HOW TO:      In order to execute common tests on a request, this function must be called on the test section at postman as follows.
// Save common tests in a global variable
// If request uses a pre request script, response must contains sent parameter.
// Request must contains the access token included.

expect(response, "Response is not an application/json object type, instead it is "
expect(response.headers["content-type"], "Header content-type does not contain a valid content," +
//Validates the response, by standard must be a string.

it('should contain headers oject and not empty', () => {
it("Response is not a 500 internal error", function(){
* NAME:        Validates requests without access_token included.
*              Validates that every test which require authentication responds with 401 status when NO ACCESS TOKEN IS GIVEN,
*              this means that request can't attach the access token on the headers section.
* HOW TO:      This function must be called on the test section at postman as follows.
it("Response body should contain a status 401", function(){
*              Validates that every test which require authentication responds with 401 status when GIVEN ACCESS TOKEN IS INVALID,
*              this means that access token given on the headers section it's expired or has an invalid format.
* HOW TO:      This function must be called on the test section at postman as follows.
describe("Validate an invalid access token", function(){
*              Request a new access_token when is called, takes the environment variables: userName and password, this function is
*              usually executed when a forced end session is required.
* HOW TO:      This function must be called on the test section at postman as follows.
*              If it is needed, mentioned environment variables can be re-assigned at pre-request tab.
// See how to use "access_token_request" assignment when requiring a new access_token.
// If success, environment variable will be setted again with the new access_token.

item.name: Request access with bad credentials
item.description:
**Feature:** Validate a login request with bad credentials. **In order** to validate bad credentials
**as** a user of HCM
**i expect** service to validates wrong attempts of login.

request.description:
**Scenario:** Wrong username. **Given** a user gives a bad username
**and** a valid password
**when** user request login
**then** user should not get access. > `Wrong username:`is considered an inexistent username or a misspell.

**Scenario:** Wrong password. **Given** a user gives a valid username
**and** a wrong password

**then** user should not get access. > `Wrong password:`is considered a misspelled password or a null value.

item.name: Request login does not include all necessary parameters
item.description:
**Feature:** Validate mandatory parameters. **In order** to achieve a valid login request
**as** a consumer of HCM's API
**i expect** service to validates all required values.

item.name: The username is not included at url request

exec: // Execute common tests before feature tests.
it("should return a 400 http status code", function(){
it("must return a 1005 code when username param is not set on to request", function(){

request.description:
**Scenario:** Login request does not include the username param on the URL. **Given** the url does not include the username param
**and** all other required values are given
**when** user request login
**then** service must throw and advice for missing value with 1005 code and a 400 http status code.

item.name: Request access with valid credentials
item.description:
**Feature:** Validate a login request with valid credentials. **In order** to login into HCM
**as** a registered user of HCM
**i expect** service to validate login when my user account. > Rules: * Active account. * Enabled account. * Not marked as deleted. * Not marked as expired. * Not marked as locked. * Not marked as deleted.

item.name: Valid credentials of an active user

exec: A valid user account must be used in order to make this test pass,
this means that used user account must be active, non expired,
non blocked, enabled, non deleted and non locked.
// Execute common tests before feature tests.
// This test case will be an exception, userName and password variables wont be unset in order to call the oauth service on further tests.
describe("User name and password variables must persist on all Test suite", function(){
it("userName environment varible is not empty", function(){
it("password environment varible is not empty", function(){
it("Response body should match versus oauth schema", function(){
it("should return a 200 http status code",function(){
it("should generate an access token", function(){
it("should have a specific format", function(){
// # means a char and - means separator
// Set the access token in an environment variable in order to be used in furter tests.
it("should have a non empty refresh token", function(){

request.description:
**Scenario:** Login request with a valid username and password. **Given** a user requests login
**and** user account is active
**when** user request login
**then** service must response with a 200 http status code **and** must generate an access_token. > `Active user account:` Means in DB isActive = 1, isEnabled = 1, isDeleted = 0

item.name: Check Permissions
item.description:
**Feature:** Validate to get permissions from an active and loged user. **In order** to check the service which get the permissions list
**as** a registered, active and loged user of HCM
**i expect** service to return my user permissions. > Rules: * Active account. * Enabled account. * Active sesin(Token generated). * Not marked as deleted. * Not marked as expired. * Not marked as locked. * Not marked as deleted.

exec: // Execute common tests before feature tests.

request.description:
**Scenario:** Request the permissions list of an active user when no access token is given. **Given** a user requests it permissions list
**and** no access token is provided **when** user send the request action
**then** service must response with a 401 http status code
**and** an "unauthorized" error message

exec: // Execute common tests before feature tests.
//Once global variable "access_token_request" is populated with desired data, simply eval it!!!
//Independly of test result of the above tests, access token must be generated again.
//Finalize given access_token in order to simulate an expired access_token

request.description:
**Scenario:** Request the permissions list of an active user with an invalid access token. **Given** a user requests it permissions list
**and** given access token is invalid **when** user send the request action
**then** service must response with a 401 http status code
**and** an "invalid_token" error message

request.description:
**Scenario:** Request the permissions list of an active user account. **Given** a user requests it permissions list
**when** user send the request action
**then** service must response with a 200 http status code **and** user's account permissions list.

it("should return a 204 http status code",function(){
it("access token should be empty", function(){

request.description:
**Scenario:** Request access token revoke(Loggin out). **Given** a user wants to end it session
**when** user send the revoke access_token request
**then** access_token must be cleared
**and** service must respond with a 204 status code
**Example:**
After access_token revoke, when the following code is called from console, expected result is "undefined" ```javascript window.sessionStorage["hcmAccessToken"]; ```

item.name: Try to revoke an inexistent access_token

exec: // This test case will be an exception, userName and password variables wont be unset in order to call the oauth service on further tests.
it("should return a 404 http status code",function(){

request.description:
**Scenario:** Try to revoke a malformed access token. **Given** a user wants to end it session
**And** service recieves a malformed access_token
**When** user send the revoke access_token request
**Then** a message error must be returned

> Next access_token value is considered as invalid. ```json { "access_token": "invalid-7521-4203-8e59-accesstoken" } ```

item.description:
**Feature:** Validate detailed information from a valid person. **In order** to validate requested information
**as** a registered user of HCM
**i expect** service to respond with the requested information.

**then** service must respond with a 404 http status code.

request.description:
**Scenario:** Request person detail information. **Given** a user request the detailed info from a person.
**and** the requested record is active
**and** is not marked as deleted
**when** user send the get person detail request
**then** service must respond with a single person object.

item.name: Request concepts with the onlyCatchable set it to true

describe("Get request of only catchable captures", function(){

request.description:
**Scenario:** Request concepts with the onlyCatchable set it to true. **Given** a user request only Catchable concepts.
**and** the requested include a valid access_token
**when** service receives the request
**then** service must respond only with those concepts which have it's property `isCatchable = true`
**and** a 200 http status code.

**Scenario:** Request getting data without access_token. **Given** a user request concepts.
